sentences.english: and if ye offer the lame and sick, is it not evil?
sentences.chinese: 將瘸腿的，有病的獻上，這不爲惡嗎。

sentences.english: Fache's eyes hardened. "You think Saunière is calling the Church a lame saint and a Draconian devil?"
sentences.chinese: 你是說索尼埃把教會稱作瘸腿的聖徒和嚴酷的魔王？

sentences.english: The one-legged beggar begins to beg eggs illegally.
sentences.chinese: 這個瘸腿乞丐開始非法乞討雞蛋。

sentences.english: And Ziba said unto the king, Jonathan hath yet a son, which is lame on his feet.
sentences.chinese: 洗巴對王說，還有約拿單的一個兒子，是瘸腿的。

sentences.english: The lamed bridegroom touched the blind bride on the arm to get her attention.
sentences.chinese: 瘸腿新郎碰了碰瞎眼的新娘，以引起她的注意。

sentences.english: It is better for you to enter life crippled than to have two feet and be thrown into hell.
sentences.chinese: 瘸腿進入永生，強如有兩隻腳被丟在地獄裏。

sentences.english: At the church door stood an old crippled soldier leaning on a crutch;
sentences.chinese: 教堂門口一個瘸腿的士兵倚靠在柺杖上。

sentences.english: And he answered, My lord, O king, my servant deceived me: for thy servant said, I will saddle me an ass, that I may ride thereon, and go to the king; because thy servant is lame.
sentences.chinese: 他回答說，我主我王，僕人是瘸腿的。

definition: disabled/handicapped/deformity on a person or animal
